data.title: A Brief History of SM Entertainment & Avex
data.meta_description: A Brief History of SM Entertainment & Avex April 11, 1988: Max Matsura founds Avex Group as a record importer and wholesaler. September 1990: Avex Group establishes the record label, avex...
data.text:
April 11, 1988: Max Matsura founds Avex Group as a record importer and wholesaler.

September 1990: Avex Group establishes the record label, avex trax.

February 1995: Lee Soo Man founds SM Entertainment Co., LTD.

July 1995: Avex Group enters into the artist management business.

October 1998: Korean President Kim Dae-jung announces his intention to phase out Korea’s ban on Japanese culture. Ultimately the ban is phased out over a period of years beginning in 1998 and continuing until 2006.

August 25, 2000: BoA debuts in Korea with the single “ID; Peace B.”

November 2000: Avex signs a licensing deal with SM Entertainment. Under this agreement, Avex will market SM Entertainment releases in Japan and Japan and SM Entertainment will market Avex releases in Korea.

SM Entertainment announces plans to establish SM Japan in which Avex will have have a 15% share, while Avex announces plans to set up a Korean subsidiary, in which SM will also have a stake, to be established when, “Korea is ready to accept Japanese culture.”

January 2001: SM Entertainment establishes SM Entertainment Japan Co., LTD.

March 7, 2001: BoA holds her first showcase in Japan at the Avex-owned club, Velfarre.

May 2001: BoA formally debuts in Japan under avex trax with a Japanese version of her debut Korean single, “ID; Peace B.” It peaks at number 20 on the Oricon charts.

March 12, 2002: BoA releases her first full-length album, Listen to My Heart, in Japan. It debuts at number one on the Oricon charts and becomes an RIAJ-certified million seller. BoA’s next five albums — Valenti, Love & Honesty, Outgrow, Made in Twenty and The Face — will all debut at number on the Oricon chart.

December 31, 2002: BoA performs at NHK’s 53rd Kohaku Uta Gassen. She will perform at the end -of-the-year festival year until 2008.

January 14, 2003: TVXQ debuts in Korea with the song, “Hug”.

March 27, 2003: BoA launches her first Japanese tour, “1st Live Tour: 2003 VALENTI.” She will hold a tour in Japan every year until 2008.

February 2004: Avex purchases 5.81% stake in SM Entertainment.

February 9, 2004: SM Entertainment releases the first product they have licensed from Avex in Korea: Namie Amuro’s Love Enhanced Single Collection.

April 27, 2005: TVXQ, using the name Tohoshinki, debut in Japan under Avex’s Rhythm Zone label with the single, “Stay With Me Tonight”.

August 2005: Avex purchases additional shares of SM Entertainment, increasing their stake from 5.76% to 6.55%. In addition, Avex’s largest shareholder, Usen Broad Networks acquires 4.44% share.

May 13, 2006: Tohoshinki begin their first tour, “1st Live Tour 2006: Heart, Mind and Soul.” The group will tour Japan every year until their split in 2009.

January 15, 2008: After releasing 15 singles in Japan, Tohoshinki releases their first chart-topping single with “Purple Line.” It is the first time a foreign male group has ever topped the Oricon charts.

December 31, 2008: Tohoshinki performs at the NHK’s 59th Kohaku Uta Gassen. They will also perform at the 60th Kohaku in 2009 and at the 62nd in 2011.

July 2009: TVXQ members Jaejoong, Yuchun and Junsu file a lawsuit in Seoul Central District Court file to nullify their contract with SM Entertainment alleging that their 13-year contract was excessively long and that earnings were not distributed fairly.

July 4-July 5, 2009: Tohoshinki close out their fourth tour, “The Secret Code: 4th Live Tour 2009” with two performances at the Tokyo Dome.

December 2009: Baek Chang-ju establishes C-JeS Entertainment to manage Jaejoong, Yuchun and Junsu.

February 2010: Avex reportedly sells off all 15.4% of their shares in SM Entertainment.

April 14, 2010: Rhythm Zone announces that Jaejoong, Yuchun and Junsu would form JYJ and will promote in Japan.

May 10, 2010: Super Junior debuts in Japan with a Japanese remake of their Korean single, “Miina (BONAMANA)”

June 2010: JYJ hold a series of concerts in Japan titled, “Thanksgiving Live” in Osaka and Tokyo.

September 2010: JYJ release their debut Japanese album, The…, topping the Oricon Weekly Chart. Shortly after the release Avex announces that it is suspending JYJ’s activities in Japan.

September 11, 2010: SNSD debuts in Japan under Universal Music Japan with “Genie.”

November 2010: SM Entertainment announces that TVXQ’s remaining members Yunho and Changmin would release an album in January.

April 2011: C-JeS Entertainment files a lawsuit alleging that Avex interfered with the group’s attempt to hold a charity concert to aid earthquake-affected areas in Japan.

June 22, 2011: SHINee debuts in Japan under EMI Records with a Japanese remake of their debut Korean single, “Replay.”

September 28, 2011: Tohoshinki releases their album — Tone — as a duo in Japan.

November 25, 2011: Avex announces they have signed exclusive contracts with Super Junior and f(x).

August 4, 2012: f(x) debuts in Japan with a Japanese version of their Korean single, “Hot Summer”.

January 18, 2013: Tokyo District Court orders Avex to release JYJ from their exclusive contract and to pay the group 660 million yen in damages; Avex says they will appeal the decision.

February 2014: EXO announces that they will debut in Japan under Avex Trax.

February 16, 2014: Avex and C-JES Entertainment settle their lawsuit; Avex agrees to no longer interfere with JYJ’s activities in Japan.

April 30, 2014: SM Entertainment, Avex Vanguard and Universal Music Japan announce that they will establish a joint company ‘everysing Japan.’

September 3, 2014: BoA releases Who’s Back? in Japan, her first album in nearly five years.

November 10, 2014: EXO releases their debut Japanese single, “Love Me Right~ Romantic Universe~”. The group sells a record-breaking 147,000 albums, the most any Korean artists has ever sold in Japan at their debut.

February 6, 2015: Tohoshinki kicks off their tenth anniversary concert tour, Tohoshinki Live Tour 2015 ～WITH～ in Japan.

May 31, 2015: The Korea Herald quotes a market analyst that who believes that SM Entertainment will begin to shift their focus from Japan to China.

November 6-8, 2015: EXO holds a series of concerts at Tokyo Dome as part of their EXO PLANET #2 - The EXO'luXion tour.

May 30, 2016: BoA holds a small concert at Nicofarre Club — formerly Velfarre — to commemorate her 15th anniversary since her debut in Japan
